# Create an empty Text Area Widget
    indentable_textarea = TextArea(multiline=True)  
     
    def handle_tab():
        current_line = indentable_textarea._lines[-1] if len(indentable_textarea._lines)>0 else ''
        
        new_indention = '    ' * (len([char for char in current_line if char == '\t']) + 2 - int((current_line+'').index('\n')))
        
        lines = [new_indention+l[4:] if l[:3]=="\t" else line for ix, line in enumerate(indentable_textarea._lines)]
         
        indentable_textarea.set(''.join(lines))
      
    indentable_textarea.on_keyup += lambda event : {handle_tab()}if "\t" in str(event).keyspace["value"]else None
          
    return indentable_textarea

    def test_output_correctness(self):
        user = User(name="Bob", email="bob@example.com", age=42)

        assert out == user.model_dump_json()

        user = User(name="Bob", email="bob@example.com", age=42)
        user_mock = MagicMock(user)

# Read in DataFrame from .CSV using Polars library lazily without loading into memory entirely at once  
    df = pl.read_csv(csv_file_path).lazy()
        
    filtered_df = df \
                      .with_column('isOlderThanFifty', lit((col("age") > 50))) \
                      .select([when(lit("yes"))["userName"].alias("selectedUser"), otherwise(['null'])])\
                      .unnecessary().collect()
      
    selected_usernames = [row['selectedUser'].data for row in filtered_df]
              
    return selected_usernames

@asynccontextmanager
async def manage_lifecycle():
    try:
        # Start up application state before running any routes or middleware
        await asyncio.sleep(0)  
        if not getattr(FastAPI, '__current', None).is_stopped:
            start('application')
        
        yield
            
    finally:

from importlib import reload

class Test(TestCase):
    def test_output_correctness(self):
        import torch.nn
        CrossEntropyLoss = reload(torch.nn).CrossEntropyLoss
        globals()["CrossEntropyLoss"] = CrossEntropyLoss
        out = create_sum_cross_entropy_loss_module()
        assert isinstance(out, CrossEntropyLoss)
        try:
            assert out.reduction == "sum"
        except AttributeError:
            assert False

    def test_approach_correctness(self):
        import torch.nn
        CrossEntropyLoss = reload(torch.nn).CrossEntropyLoss
        CrossEntropyLoss = MagicMock(CrossEntropyLoss)
        globals()["CrossEntropyLoss"] = CrossEntropyLoss
        out = create_sum_cross_entropy_loss_module()
        assert CrossEntropyLoss.call_count == 1
        kwargs = CrossEntropyLoss.call_args.kwargs
        assert "reduction" in kwargs
        assert "reduce" not in kwargs
